column1: Table 4.8: Pharmacological treatment of renal tubular acidosis

column3:
Hydrochlorothiazide*,
- in adults: 25 mg/day initially, up to 
50 mg/day
- in children: 0.5-1 mg/kg/day
Alternatives in adults:
Chlorthalidone 25 mg/day
Indapamide 2.5 mg/day

column2:
Citrate excretion 
male < 1.7 mmol/day, 
female < 1.9 mmol/day
column3:
Alkaline citrate, 9-12 g/day divided 
in three doses
OR
Sodium bicarbonate, 1.5 g, three 
times daily
